items.title: Standardisere metadatakvalitet opp mot EDP
items.body:
Se behov: https://github.com/datadeling/behov-issue-tracker/issues/138

EDP: https://data.europa.eu/mqa/methodology
EUs gitlab: https://gitlab.com/dataeuropa

gapanalyse: https://digdir.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/FDKUtviklingsteam/Delte%20dokumenter/General/Gapanalyse-metadatakvalitet.xlsx?d=w42b8b3c5db13468d944222d68b1e1719&csf=1&web=1

- Skal vi tillate datasett som ikke tilfredstiller alle obligatoriske krav? (sjekk dagens tilstand)
- Utvide https://data.norge.no/guidance/metadata
- Validere properties fra EDP som vi ikke gjør
- Publisere shacl-reglene vi har (https://github.com/Informasjonsforvaltning/fdk-metadata-quality-service/tree/main/src/main/resources/shapes) til dcat-ap-no
- Implementere steg 2 (sjekk av URL)
- Vurdere om readability skal være med



I tillegg må vi støtte egenskaper som mangler i registreringsløsningen i data.norge

items.title: Technical mappings revision
Provide our own JSON-LD Schema subset for deployments
items.body:
Related to https://github.com/esmero/archipelago-deployment/issues/56

# What?

Giancarlo had the amazing idea of instead of depending on JSON-LD files that come and go, we provide for new deployments a smaller subset that can be used directly in 

/admin/structure/strawberry_keynameprovider/schema_org/edit 

We can also add a link in a README.md file inside strawberryfield module

This requires some group effort to select the best properties. Of course this is a starting point and people can extend or replace. But its a good and stable starting point

This base `@context` file will be hosted in this repo and will have its own versioning.
Given the flexible nature archipelago people then can add other plugin instances via the UI to expand on further vocabularies

Thanks @giancarlobi

items.title: Tydlighet med hur datasetet refereras och version, datum publicerat etc.,..
items.body:
Skall vi i Wikidata peka på ett dataset som en källa så bör vissa saker finnas
- unikt iD på datasettet
- helst att detta ID är presistent jmf [DOI](https://www.doi.org/) och publikationer [länk](https://www.pidforum.org/t/pids-forpublications-and-data/297) 
- att datat i sig har persistent id, version, datum då det publicerats
- kan vi med en länk se versionen av datat är det ännu bättre
  - exempel hur Wikidata posten för WIkidata _Sveriges Dataportal (Q92961134)_ [såg ut 3 maj 2020](https://www.wikidata.org/w/index.php?title=Q92961134&oldid=1172170599)
     - alla [versioner för Q92961134](https://www.wikidata.org/w/index.php?title=Q92961134&action=history)

**jag tycker mig sakna detta i https://www.dataportal.se/**

jmf . Wikidata [Cite This Page Q92961134](https://www.wikidata.org/w/index.php?title=Special:CiteThisPage&page=Q92961134&id=1172170599&wpFormIdentifier=titleform) som visar hur posten om Sveriges Dataportal [Q92961134](https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q92961134?uselang=sv) skall citeras....
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14206509/85270794-218b2b80-b47a-11ea-92c8-985600093000.png)


Bäst vore om vi börjar använda [DOI](https://www.doi.org/) eller skapar en egen för dataset/data se hur [British Library jobbar aktivt](https://www.pidforum.org/t/pids-for-publications-and-data/297) i projekt som [FREYA](https://www.project-freya.eu/en/pid-graph/the-pid-graph) för att de som publicerar vetenskapliga publikationer skall använda [DOI](https://www.doi.org/) och [ORCID](https://orcid.org/) för författare

items.title: LdpService: rediriger vers l'interface quand on visualise une donnée avec un Accept text/html
items.body:
Lorsqu'un navigateur va sur une URL comme https://data.virtual-assembly.org/users/srosset81 avec un Accept header `text/html` (consultation depuis un browser) ne pourrions-nous pas rediriger automatiquement sur l'interface "par défaut" (ou "préférée") définie dans le middleware ?

J'ai vu qu'ils font ça pour l'[ESCO](https://ec.europa.eu/esco/portal/api) (open data des compétences):

- Si on va sur http://data.europa.eu/esco/occupation/528f90ed-e250-48bd-aacc-ffb7b1de5654 on est redirigé sur [une page](https://ec.europa.eu/esco/portal/occupation?uri=http%3A%2F%2Fdata.europa.eu%2Fesco%2Foccupation%2F528f90ed-e250-48bd-aacc-ffb7b1de5654&conceptLanguage=fr&full=true#&uri=http://data.europa.eu/esco/occupation/528f90ed-e250-48bd-aacc-ffb7b1de5654) qui permet de visualiser la donnée.
- Par contre si on utilise Postman ou Insomnia avec un Accept header de type `text/turtle`, on voit les données sous forme de triple.

Est-ce que c'est possible selon les bonnes conceptions du web sémantique ? J'ai l'impression que oui, et que c'est le sens même du header Accept.

Cela devrait être une option bien sûr, pas d'obligation à définir une interface "préférée" côté middleware.

Ping @simonLouvet @tfrancart

items.title: Identifier cardinality

labels.name: future-work
labels.description: this topic will be dealt in the future

items.body:
On the class dcat:Dataset the property dct:identifier has cardinality 0-* and the usage note:
“This property contains the main identifier for the Dataset, e.g. the URI or other unique identifier in the context of the Catalogue ”
The part of the text that states that the property contains ‘the main identifier’ seems to indicate that there can only be one such identifier. 
I would recommend that either the text is changes to reflect the given cardinality or the cardinality is changed to reflect the given text.

items.title: Look for other sources of data
items.body:
_Edited by Bart_
Check out other databases with food info.
For the time being we will use:
* OpenFoodFacts
* AECOC

From our research, we have found: 

* **FDA:** https://ndb.nal.usda.gov/ndb/search/list?home=true

* ~~**Wikidata:** https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q89~~

* **Pic2Recipe:** Recipe databes with photos used in research 
http://pic2recipe.csail.mit.edu/

* **Food2Fork.** It has a restricted API (50 calls/day for free)  
https://www.food2fork.com/about/api

* _Spoonacular._ I think it is a great discovery. Restricted API but academic access: 5000 calls/day paying 10$/mo https://spoonacular.com/food-api

* **Edamdam:** nutrient and recipe database. Restricted API 25calls/minute for free https://developer.edamam.com/food-database-api

* **Open product data**: Quite similar to open food facts (product centered) 
http://product-open-data.com/

* **Phenol explorer**: It's additional data on compounds that affect the microbiome.
http://phenol-explorer.eu/downloads

* ~~**BDECA**: Base de Datos Española de Composición de Alimentos: 
http://www.bedca.net~~

* **BigOven API**: Only recipes
http://api2.bigoven.com

* **Global Food Composition Databases**: http://www.fao.org/infoods/infoods/tables-and-databases/faoinfoods-databases/en/

* **Chomp API - Powerful Food Database API**: High-quality data on over 535,000 branded food products. https://chompthis.com/api/#examples

items.title: Rebranding out of lleb to Farer
items.body:
lleb labs should be generally separated from the intranet branding. Through some discussions with @cyckl that can be affirmed, the current idea is:
- Change the "lleb labs intranet" to:
  - "The Farer Group"
  - "Farer"
- Establish `nic.fa` to control domains inside the Farer intranet
  - Delegate `.fa` to be owned by The Farer Group
    - Domain registration is open to any via automated request
    - `nic.fa` and name services (eg. `wiki.fa`, `music.fa`, `news.fa`) are restricted to The Farer Group  
    - `lleb.fa` restricted to lleb labs and their personnel

This will have breaking changes as all Tailscale IPs **will change** and all members and servers will have to re-authenticate with the new Tailscale organisation. This does create the optimal time to change infrastructure as we will have to, in lamest terms, "restart" the networking half of things and re-configure based on how things currently are.

As much input and feedback is needed. [Please vote appropriately](https://wiki.lleb/lleb-and-you/voting/) and aid us in a smooth transition as much as possible.

items.title: Interpretation and critical discussion
items.body:
### Requirements:
- Discuss model deployment from a technical point of view
- Try to interpret your model from the domain expert view. Is the model good
enough? What are possible consequences of deploying the model? What needs to
be monitored after deployment?
- Discuss model deployment from a societal point of view. What does it mean for
society if such a model would be deployed at large scale? Are there any dangers?
### Remarks:
- One important point is if you have any biases in your dataset (e.g. if the data was
predominantely white middle age males in it). Take a look at Open data and data
bias | data.europa.eu

items.title: Solar Data GIS for Balkans
items.body:
Hi, all!

This idea is about to inspire people in usage of solar energy and reduce household fuel and electricity costs.
We can try do it by showing the comparison of local electricity prices and potential of Rooftop Solar installation.  
The one map can show this two type of data in real-time and\or historical average resolutions.

_Solar data_
There are two most used indicators about solar: Direct Normal Irradiance (DNI) and Global Horizontal Irradiance (GHI) layers.

> **Direct Normal Irradiance (DNI)** is direct beam radiation. Generally, it is used to calculate Concentrating PV (Photovoltaic Panels) output. Concentrating PV uses optics to concentrate the solar radiation in a way that captures only the DNI and not the diffuse or reflected components of the incident solar radiation.

> **Global Horizontal Irradiance (GHI)** is the total solar radiation incident on a horizontal surface. It is the sum of Direct Normal Irradiance (DNI), Diffuse Horizontal Irradiance, and ground-reflected radiation.

- [ ] the first question for an implementation is how Planet's platform may help to get data of these indicators? Should we looking for other data providers?

The electricity prices data probably should be free available by countries regulation agencies. However it may not be aggregated from different electricity providers.

- [ ] so, the second question for an implementation is finding Balkans-wide electricity historical and actual prices data


This is very brief idea description. Welcome to evaluate and contribute!

_About myself._
My personal goal for this hackaton is getting my very first experience with programming geo application and earth observation data processing pipelines. I'm familiar with python, google cloud platform (Functions, Storage, BigQuery), AWS (Storage, Image Rekognition), deep learning (TensorFlow, Keras). I got ARSET introduction training about remote-sensing, NASA Earth observation products, SAR (Sentinel 2) data processing.

items.title: Need for a common approach to modeling dataset series in DCAT-AP

labels.name: future-work
labels.description: this topic will be dealt in the future

labels.name: status:waitingForDecisionW3C
labels.description: The issue is handled at W3C

items.body:
The need for a common approach to modeling dataset series has already been identified as a _significant outstanding issue_ in DCAT (https://github.com/w3c/dxwg/issues/868), and it will hopefully be adressed in DCAT 3. 

However, in the meantime, various national and domain specific profiles of DCAT-AP 2.0 already suggest to implement structures to handle dataset series despite DCAT or DCAT-AP not offering the necessary properties/class or specific guidelines for this directly in the specification documents. Several approaches seems to indicate use of dct:hasPart/dct:isPartOf although other proposals have also emerged.

It would be beneficial if this issue could be prioritised in DCAT-AP future work.

items.title: Feature/use new editor api
items.body:
To test well, especially Niels as he knows more about this plugin than me. I actually think this is better than the original, if you get a snippet in the service (this part is done by GN and mocked in the dummy app) you will get a card in the sidebar, asking you if you want to insert as an attachment or as a document, the attachment only happens if you are inside a besluit.

When inserting we have some problems with the lump nodes but are not related to this PR neither this repo, basically sometimes you can edit a lump node and the style is not correct if the lump node property is not the only one in the div.

Also if you could check the translations it would be great I tried to do them with google translate but... you know.

items.title: "Plan samenleven" subsidy improvements
items.body:
- fix typo nummer => nummers
- set default to 0 in convertInputValuesToNumbers function
- save totalContribution in database

To test totalContribution, create some forms with values in the table and after saving you can execute the following query to view the values in the database:

```
      PREFIX foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/>
      PREFIX ext: <http://mu.semte.ch/vocabularies/ext/>
      PREFIX subsidie: <http://data.vlaanderen.be/ns/subsidie#>
      PREFIX lblodSubsidie: <http://lblod.data.gift/vocabularies/subsidie/>
      PREFIX transactie: <http://data.vlaanderen.be/ns/transactie#>
      PREFIX besluit: <http://data.vlaanderen.be/ns/besluit#>
      PREFIX m8g: <http://data.europa.eu/m8g/>
      PREFIX dct: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
      PREFIX adms: <http://www.w3.org/ns/adms#>
      PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
      PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>
      PREFIX planSamenleven: <http://lblod.data.gift/vocabularies/subsidie/plan-samenleven/>

      SELECT DISTINCT ?form ?totalContribution
      WHERE {
        ?subsidie a subsidie:SubsidiemaatregelConsumptie ;
                  transactie:isInstantieVan <http://lblod.data.info/id/subsidy-measure-offers/a2d920b2-d266-4555-b023-63632997c406> ;
                  dct:source ?form .

        ?form lblodSubsidie:planLivingTogetherTable ?table.
        ?table planSamenleven:totalContribution ?totalContribution.
      }
```

items.title: Erfaringsopsamling vedr. anvendelse af de anbefalede klassifikationer fra EU

labels.name: future work
labels.description: This issue will be addressed in future work

items.body:
I forbindelse med DCAT-AP udpeger EU Kommissionen en række klassifikationer skal anvendes til opmærkning af dels kataloger, datasæt og datasætrepræsentationer. Derudover introducerer DCAT-AP-DK få yderligere klassifikation til anvendelse i dansk fællesoffentlig kontekst.

Det er vigtigt at danske interessenter forholder sig til disse klassifikationer med henblik på en vurdering af deres anvendelighed. Dette kan nemlig få betydning for beslutningen omkring egenskabers kravniveau i en dansk profilering af DCAT-AP.

Her under kan I se hvilke klassifikationer der er i sving ift. forskellige egenskaber/felter 
(Se evt. også kapitel 5 'Controlled Vocabularies i DCAT-AP) https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/sites/default/files/distribution/access_url/2019-12/12f0dc1d-50b6-43e4-90c2-0afe213ac2be/DCAT_AP_2.0.0.pdf. 

Bemærk at HVIS den pågældende egenskab anvendes så SKAL de(n) udpegede klassifikation anvendes (med enkelte undtagelser - se i noterne).

Link til implementering af validering af anvendelse af klassifikationerne i DCAT-AP (constraints concerning the usage of controlled vocabularies) https://github.com/SEMICeu/DCAT-AP/blob/master/releases/2.0.1/dcat-ap_2.0.1_shacl_mdr-vocabularies.shape.ttl

# Egenskab: emne (datatema)
KLASSIFIKATION: EU Datatemaer
Se klassifikationens indhold: https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/at-concept-scheme/-/resource/authority/data-theme/?target=Browse&uri=http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/data-theme
* URI: http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/data-theme

# Egenskab: emne (forvaltningsopgave)
KLASSIFIKATION(ER): FORM/KLE
Se klassifikationernes indhold: 
https://www.form-online.dk/soegning, 
http://www.kle-online.dk/soegning

# Egenskab: opdateringsfrekvens
KLASSIFIKATION: EU Frekvenser
Se klassifikationens indhold: https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/at-concept-scheme/-/resource/authority/frequency/?target=Browse&uri=http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/frequency
* URI: http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/frequency

# Egenskab: medietype
KLASSIFIKATION: Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). 
Se klassifikationens indhold: http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml
* URI: http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml

# Egenskab: format
KLASSIFIKATION: EU Filtyper
Se klassifikationens indhold: https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/at-concept-scheme/-/resource/authority/file-type/?target=Browse&uri=http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/file-type
* URI: http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/file-type

# Egenskab: sprog
KLASSIFIKATION: EU Sprog
Se klassifikationens indhold: https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/at-dataset/-/resource/dataset/language
* URI: http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/language

# Egenskab: geografisk område
KLASSIFIKATION(ER): EU klassifikationer: kontinenter, lande, stednavne, Geonames
Se klassifikationernes indhold: 
https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/at-concept-scheme/-/resource/authority/continent/?target=Browse&uri=http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/continent 
, https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/at-concept-scheme/-/resource/authority/country/?target=Browse&uri=http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/country, 
https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/at-concept-scheme/-/resource/authority/place/?target=Browse&uri=http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/place, http://sws.geonames.org/"

* URI: http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/continent/, 
* URI: http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/country, 
* URI: http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/place/
* URI: http://sws.geonames.org/
Note:
The EU Vocabularies Name Authority Lists must be used for continents, countries and places that are in those lists; if a particular location is not in one of the mentioned Named Authority Lists, Geonames URIs must be used.

# Egenskab: status
KLASSIFIKATION: ADMS Statusser
Se klassifikationens indhold:
http://purl.org/adms/status/ indeholder følgende udfaldsrum:
http://purl.org/adms/status/Completed, 
http://purl.org/adms/status/Deprecated,
http://purl.org/adms/status/UnderDevelopment,
http://purl.org/adms/status/Withdrawn"
* URI: http://purl.org/adms/status/

# Egenskab: (udgiver)type
KLASSIFIKATION: ADMS udgivertyper
Se klassifikationens indhold:
http://purl.org/adms/publishertype/ indeholder følgende udfaldsrum:
http://purl.org/adms/publishertype/Academia-ScientificOrganisation
http://purl.org/adms/publishertype/Company
http://purl.org/adms/publishertype/IndustryConsortium
http://purl.org/adms/publishertype/LocalAuthority
http://purl.org/adms/publishertype/NationalAuthority
http://purl.org/adms/publishertype/NonGovernmentalOrganisation
http://purl.org/adms/publishertype/NonProfitOrganisation
http://purl.org/adms/publishertype/PrivateIndividual(s)
http://purl.org/adms/publishertype/RegionalAuthority
http://purl.org/adms/publishertype/StandardisationBody
http://purl.org/adms/publishertype/SupraNationalAuthority"
* URI: http://purl.org/adms/publishertype/

Evt. fremtidig mapning til: 
KLASSIFIKATION: Offentlige organisationstyper 
https://digst.github.io/IT-System-AP/SYS-AP/docs/#klassifikation-offentlige-organisationstyper
* URI: https://data.gov.dk/concept/profile/public-org-types

# Egenskab: (licens)type
KLASSIFIKATION: ADMS licenstyper
Se klassifikationens indhold:  http://purl.org/adms/licencetype/  indeholder følgende udfaldsrum:
http://purl.org/adms/licencetype/Attribution
http://purl.org/adms/licencetype/PublicDomain
http://purl.org/adms/licencetype/ViralEffect-ShareAlike
http://purl.org/adms/licencetype/ShareAlike-NotCompatible
http://purl.org/adms/licencetype/ShareAlike-Compatible
http://purl.org/adms/licencetype/NonCommercialUseOnly
http://purl.org/adms/licencetype/NoDerivativeWork
http://purl.org/adms/licencetype/RoyaltiesRequired
http://purl.org/adms/licencetype/ReservedNames-Endorsement-OfficialStatus
http://purl.org/adms/licencetype/NominalCost
http://purl.org/adms/licencetype/GrantBack
http://purl.org/adms/licencetype/JurisdictionWithinTheEU
http://purl.org/adms/licencetype/OtherRestrictiveClauses
http://purl.org/adms/licencetype/KnownPatentEncumbrance
http://purl.org/adms/licencetype/UnknownIPR
* URI: http://purl.org/adms/licencetype/

# Egenskab: tilgængelighedstype
KLASSIFIKATION: Tilgængeligshedstyper (for distributioner)
Se klassifikationens indhold: 
temporary, experimental, available, stable.
* URI: http://data.europa.eu/r5r/availability/

Følgende er ikke direkte anvendt i DCAT-AP, men kan være relevant at kigge på:
# Egenskab: rettighedsudsagnstype (på klassen Rettighedsudsagn)
KLASSIFIKATION: Adgangsrettigheder
Se klassifikationernes indhold: https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/at-concept-scheme/-/resource/authority/access-right/?target=Browse&uri=http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/access-right
Indeholder følgende udfaldsrum:
http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/access-right/NON_PUBLIC
http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/access-right/PUBLIC
http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/access-right/RESTRICTED
http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/access-right/SENSITIVE
* URI: http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/access-right

# Egenskab: personoplysningskategori
KLASSIFIKATION: Personoplysningskategorier
Indeholder følgende udfaldsrum:
https://data.gov.dk/concept/core/personaldata-type/SensitivePersonalData (følsomme personoplysninger)
https://data.gov.dk/concept/core/personaldata-type/GeneralPersonalData (almindelige personoplysninger) https://data.gov.dk/concept/core/personaldata-type/CivilRegistrationNumberData (personnummeroplysninger)
https://data.gov.dk/concept/core/personaldata-type/DataAboutCriminalOffences (oplysninger om strafbare forhold)
https://data.gov.dk/concept/core/personaldata-type/NonPersonalData (ingen personoplysninger)
https://www.retsinformation.dk/eli/lta/2018/502
https://eur-lex.europa.eu/eli/reg/2016/679/oj
https://www.datatilsynet.dk/generelt-om-databeskyttelse/hvad-er-personoplysninger

# Egenskab: fortrolighedsgrad
KLASSIFIKATION: Fortrolighedsgrader

items.title: Please record here interesting applications that use Linked Data
items.body:
This issue arose from a need to be able to give people examples of Linked Data in action, especially examples which might be familiar to people who have probably not even heard of Linked Data.

A question  was put to the public-lod forum in the thread [Examples of applications built on LOD](https://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-lod/2018Nov/0000.html).

items.title: http://data.europa.eu/r5r/ links to e-Government Core Vocabularies on joinup
items.body:
Hello,
dcatap`s namespace http://data.europa.eu/r5r/ redirects to https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/semantic-interoperability-community-semic/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies, a page for the e-Government Core Vocabularies.

In my opinion, a redirect to https://github.com/SEMICeu/DCAT-AP would be more helpful.
Or https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SEMICeu/DCAT-AP/master/releases/2.1.0/dcat-ap_2.1.0.rdf
Or https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SEMICeu/DCAT-AP/2.1.0-draft/releases/2.1.0/dcat-ap_2.1.0.rdf
Or maybe https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/semantic-interoperability-community-semic/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe

items.title: Item list shows loading indicator forever
items.body:
[...] it seems that **there is a problem appearing on the items list of the collection itself.**

The **loading icon of the items** never disappears.

While if I go directly to the url of the item I don't get any problem in the visualization.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/98519154/177174530-dd8022e6-26c0-4061-b9d0-c34695c94e02.png)

_Originally posted by @chiarch84 in https://github.com/radiantearth/stac-browser/issues/144#issuecomment-1173885694_

items.title: [BRUKERHISTORIE] API for eksport til EDP
items.body:
Som: nasjonalt aksesspunkt for åpne offentlige data
Ønsker jeg å: tilby et åpent API i tråd med DCAT-AP v2 (EU)
Slik at: beskrivelser av åpne datasett kan utveksles med den europeiske åpne data-portalen (EDP) og andre 

API-et skal være åpent og kan i prinsippet konsumeres av hvem som helst. EU etterspør også statistikk for bruk av katalogens API. 

Relatert til epos: #91 

Lenke til design: 
Lenke til løsningsarkitektur:


NB! Når vi tilbyr DCAT-AP (EU) må vi bruke temaklassifiseringen som er påkrevd, dvs opprinnelig EU-klassifisering. Denne er faset ut, men er (delvis) ivaretatt ved hjelp av Skos-mapping i Los, se https://github.com/difi/los/issues/93

items.title: URI collision between Cost value and CCCEV Supportedvalue value properties
items.body: Both properties have the same URI in CCCEV (https://semiceu.github.io/CCCEV/releases/2.00/#Supported%20Value) and CPSV-AP. The proposal is to change the Cost value URI to http://data.europa.eu/m8g/hasvalue

items.title: Channel
items.body:
We want to use Channel as a means for secured communication and exchange of information (e.g. documents, questions and clarifications, etc.) between buyers and economic operators.

We have the following questions:

1. Is there a property in the current class Channel used in the CPVS-AP to specify the Data Service end-point URI? We don't see any placeholder for that datum.
2. Is the class Channel is defined in the CPVS-AP namespace, or is it being reused from another ontology/vocabulary? Is reused, which vocabulary, please?

items.title: Suggestion to add dct:format and dcat:mediaType to dcat:DataService

labels.name: feedback
labels.description: Issues stemming from external feedback to the WG

milestone.title: DCAT3 4PWD
milestone.description: This milestone reflects a prioritization of issues for the 4th Public Working Draft of DCAT version 3.

items.body:
### formats and mediaTypes of a DataService
Status: In real use in [the Norwegian national Data Catalog](https://data.norge.no/dataservices). Added as national extensions in [DCAT-AP-NO](https://data.norge.no/specification/dcat-ap-no/).

Creator: Jim J. Yang

Deliverable(s): DCAT3

## Stakeholders
Providers of DataServices/APIs
Consumers of DataServices/APIs
Providers of DataService Catalogs
Consumers of DataService Catalogs

## Problem statement
Which formats/mediaTypes a DataService may support is one of the considerations you need to take when deciding whether a DataService is (re)usable or not.

In the 2nd Working Draft of DCAT3, dcat:DataService (still) doesn’t have properties dct:format and dcat:mediaType as in dcat:Distribution. Possible ways to describe formats/mediaTypes of a DataService are thus:
1.	Using dcat:DataService/dcat:endpointDescription. The main disadvantage is that it doesn’t necessarily ensure a standardized way of expressing formats and mediaTypes, which makes it impossible to e.g. sort/query DataServices according to formats/mediaTypes.
2.	Using dcat:DataService/dcat:servesDataset -> dcat:Dataset/dcat:distribution -> dcat:Distribution/dct:format (or dcat:Distribution/dcat:mediaType). The main disadvantage is the unnecessary overhead in creating and maintaining all those extra Distributions (and Datasets).

## Requirements
Add the following properties to dcat:DataService: 
- format, dct:format, dct:MediaTypeOrExtent
- media type, dcat:mediaType, dct:MediaType 

## Related use cases
["How to express available formats for a dcat:DataService (Issue #1055)"](https://github.com/w3c/dxwg/issues/1055), which at that time (Sep 2019) was already “tagged as a future priority”.

items.title: Scoping of credibility corpus
items.body:
Investigation of the data.europa corpora containing French and English datasets related to rumours. Purpose of this work is to understand the usefulness of this dataset for the rumour matching element of the tool. This will involve working in python to provide some descriptive statistics and feedback on the potential of these datasets.

Link to corpora:
https://data.europa.eu/data/datasets/5840066288ee38426dc65bb3?locale=en

Share results back either in notebook form or through a google doc.
